title: Chin Thado (1983) Genesis Portion
description: Chin Tedim translation of the first four chapters of Genesis published in 1983 by the Bible Society of India. The Tedim or Zomi language is spoken mostly in Burma and India. In Chin State, it is spoken in Tedim and Tonzang townships, while in Sagaing Division, it is spoken in Kalay and Mawlaik townships. Dialects are Sokte and Kamhau.

language.name: Thado Chin
language.area: Manipur, Chandel, Churachandpur, Senapati, Tamenglong districts; Assam; Mizoram, northeast; Nagaland, Kohima District; Tripura. Also in Myanmar.
